description:
3 and a half years later this is my favorite place to grab sushi.

I come here all the time.  My friends come here all the time.  I've made friends with people that come here ALL THE TIME just because I see them so often.
The quality of fish is always good, Sake and beer flow like Niagra Falls, the people that work here are fantastic.  It's always a party and I am so happy to have found this place.  There aren't many restaurants where you end up talking to tables that are near you for much of the evening.  

For a unique experience and great fish, come here.

I've read some reviews where people are disappointed with a delivery or some nonsense like that and rate them poorly after going there many times before and never having an issue.  Yelp is great, and then there are the a-holes on it who review poorly to be re compensated.  Basically bottom feeders in my opinion.

I have come here over a hundred times now, never have I gotten sick.  I have ordered delivery dozens of times, same story.  And I have a weak stomach, so if anyone is getting ill, it's me.

This place has so many people coming back all the time, that isn't a fluke.

My large family now comes here, my coworkers, so many friends that I've brought just once.  Thank you Sqwers for providing the funnest place to have dinner/lunch on such an often basis.  You have a FOREVER patron in me.
author: Natasha B.

description:
To preface: I've always ordered SQwers through UberEats and have done so about 5 times now. This last time was a total let-down, and I ended up having to throw almost 75% of the food away because of poor quality.  I don't know if that they had an "off" day, but when you serve uncooked raw foods, it's ALWAYS best to put your best foot forward, because raw foods could easily get your patrons sick.  "off" day or not, the restaurant shouldn't have sent out un-fresh fish or sub-par quality fish.  

We ordered a bunch of different sashimi plates, chirashi, sushi, Ikura, the likes. All of the items that warrant fresh tasting seafood, and you can definitely tell if it wasn't.  There were slivers of sinew, they used ESCOLAR which is something that gives you NOT SO GOOD PROBLEMS on the other end if you consume it, Tuna that looked like it had been sliced with a dull-knife, and the Ikura tasted old and fishy.  Halfway through my meal, we had to chuck it because the fish was either too mushy, too fishy or too sinewy.  We spent almost $130 on that meal for 4, and was sorely disappointed. 

There are MANY if not hundreds of sushi restaurants in Bay Area, seriously, you have to step up your game! 

Rant done.
author: Kay H.

description:
I LOVE this place! 
I can't believe that they're people who don't like it. 
It's right around the corner of my place, so I go in quite often (SQwers nights are quite a thing).
I bring all my friends in here and sometimes I just go on my on or try to pick some food up (I say try because literally I end up eating there). 
The lunch bento box is great and super inexpensive. The dinner combo is as well. 
Their Hamachi Kama is absolutely delicious. I can't live without it! 
The place is small and very welcoming and what can I say about the staff?!! Simon & Mr. Lee are AMAZING! I love them! They always hook us up with some free Sake/beer and they also drink with us. I usually come out tipsy hahaha it's so fun! 
I eat here at least once every week and I'll keep doing it! My friends also loved it and they want to come back. 
Keep it going, guys! You're doing such a great job!
author: Diana F.

description:
On a last minute find, we found this spot for dinner in the area. Upon entering, we were already greeted with a warm welcome from the waiters filled with jokes and laughter. Let me tell you, this is one of the most fun times I have had at a restaurant. We ordered one Lychee Soju ($11) and one Large Hot Sake ($6), which we ended up sharing with the waiter. Soon enough, he came around pouring us more shots of sake eventually finishing an entire bottle. This spot was a fun time and I would come back just for the environment.

On the other hand, the food was mediocre. The three of us shared the Beef Sukiyaki ($11), Cherry Blossom Roll ($12), Godzilla Roll ($13), Giants Roll ($14), and one more roll that we had the chef surprise us with. For the rolls, they were all on the small and skimpy side. Also, the sukiyaki did not have a sweet broth flavor to it either while the beef too well done.

Overall, pricey and mediocre food, but the fun and lively environment from the waiters made this whole experience so memorable and worth it.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
SQwers is one block from my apartment, it's like a comfort food for me. Their staff is really friendly and nice. I used to always get the Don Buri's and when I am feeling sushi I get the lion king roll because it's baked and a good choice if you want sushi but feel like eating something warm.
They also gave us complimentary miso soup which was really nice. Would definitely come back. 
Try: Lion king roll!!
author: Deki T.

description: They've got a great 9.99 lunch special bento box. I usually get the spicy tuna roll and sashimi. Good fish. Amazing price. Comes w miso soup and salad. Quick service. I've never been here for lunch but it's a Great lunch spot. Nothing fancy inside but nice and clean. Every time I'm here I think I should come back more often.
author: David A R.

description:
Found this place on UberEats and this is officially my new favorite takeout spot! Delivery was quick too which is always a big plus.

I ordered their Avocado Sushi ($4.50) which gives you 2 pieces. This will give you the most perfect bite. The sushi rice was cooked perfectly - it was sticky and warm and mushy. The avocado slices on top gave the bite a creamy texture and the sesame seeds sprinkled on top was a nice touch. However, the Gyu Don ($10.99) was the real winner. You'll get a hearty bowl of white rice, topped with simmered sliced beef and sauteed onions. The beef broth in the bowl made the rice taste so hearty, and the sliced beef was very tender and delicate. The bowl is also garnished with pickled ginger and seaweed for a little extra flavor. 

I loved their food so much that I ordered from them again the week after and it was just as yummy as the first time. You'll receive delicious food, the portion sizes are generous, and the price is very reasonable. Highly recommended!
author: Chisholm T.

description:
This place was unexpectedly amazing! My wife and I have been enjoying lots of great omakase lately, and we recently traveled to Japan, so we've been a bit spoiled when it comes to sushi. That said, I really enjoyed SQwers! I didn't get the sushi, but tried some, and it was quite good for a roll (I know, I know, sounds a bit snobish, haha). I had the Chicken Katsu Don and it was spot on!

Food aside, though, what really impressed me was the service. As soon as we sat down we were brought miso soup and edamame, which was comped. At the end of the meal, we were brought multiple shots of sake. Please don't expect this whenever you go here, but wanted to mention it because it really felt like they cared and appreciated our business, even though we were all (4 of us) strangers to them.

Maybe I wouldn't add this to a "must do" list of SF restaurants, but I will definitely go back here based on my experience!
author: Derrick S.

description:
Great experience! Would definitely come back again.
Pros:
- Immediate seating
- Fast, friendly service
- Tasty sushi dishes
- Reasonable pricing
Cons:
- none
author: Anne G.

description:
TL;DR: Mix-up with Grubhub. Great and caring customer service!

I ordered delivery through Grubhub -- I got the Veggie Tempura dinner serving which comes with miso soup and rice. When I received this order, it didn't come with miso and rice.

I reported this to Grubhub and the GH customer service sorted it out with the restaurant and just ended up giving me a small Grubhub credit for the inconvenience. I thought this was the end of story.

Next thing I know, the doorbell rings and it's with a brand new full order of veggie tempura with miso soup and rice... attached with a sincere note that there was a misunderstanding and that this dinner was on the house.

This is such a sweet gesture and I appreciate the effort for such a small error! I'll definitely continue to order from Skwers - I really enjoy their Salmon Don and obviously their tempura!

Thank you, Skwers!
author: Marissa C.

description: Don't get me wrong, the food here was pretty decent Japanese food; however, the service was TERRIBLE. The guy taking our order didn't give us spoons for our miso and told us to just stir with a chopstick and slurp from the bowl. He was also pretty rude overall, and said splitting checks were, "IMPOSSIBLE!"
author: Jerel L.

description:
We recently stumbled across this place and were very surprised about how good everything was.

When it comes to sushi, I'm usually of the opinion that everything tastes pretty much the same after you dip it in soy sauce. I still like sushi and I've had bad sushi before, but it is rare for a place that stands out. I was surprised to taste the difference with the fish used in this establishment. Every dish tasted fresh and it stood out. It was really good!

Another aspect of this establishment that we really enjoy is the staff-specifically Simon. He has been our waiter both times we've been here and he is absolutely awesome. He is friendly and attentive, but beyond that the guys is really funny. For instance, when we first came here for a lunch date, he kept trying to get us drunk in broad daylight, repeatedly offering sake with every item we ordered. It might not come across as funny, but the way he did it was absolutely hilarious. 

Thanks Simon- see you soon.
author: Maksim K.

description:
We continue ordering sushi delivery and continue to hope it will be awesome. But it never is! Until this time... Finally sushi delivery has been redeemed!
Everything was great! In fact, we're placing another order online right now...
author: Pamela G.

description: This is literally my favorite sushi place in the city. The food is always fresh, delicious, and satisfying. Every employee is always warm and kind - plus, the delivery always arrives waaaay earlier than the given estimated time. I ordered tonight and they threw in a free sushi roll at no cost, so sweet! Everyone should try this place and tip WELL, they are awesome.
author: Hannah W.

description:
Now that Wild Sushi appears to be no longer delivering, I've been trying even more sushi places.  After returning from a visit to NC, I felt the need for fish.

I got my standard test order: wakame salad, and sashimi (shiro maguro, maguro, sake).  The salad was perfect, moist but not wet, on a bed of lettuce.  The fish was excellent, though the salmon was the tiniest bit crunchy, and the maguro slices were small.  But the albacore was enormous and buttery.

It was also very reasonably priced, and I got a free California roll!
author: Joey Y.

description:
This review is for a take-out order from Eat 24. My order was ready extremely fast (I very much appreciate this) and the staff was over the top friendly to me when I stopped in to pick it up. 

As for the sushi, it was good! For mid-priced sushi, I think this place is a win.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Very friendly service with yummy Japanese food at a reasonable price.

We had the salmon don, tempura soba and philly roll. Salmon was fresh and the tempura was deliciously crisp. 

Our food came quickly and we were also provided some miso soup on the house. 

A great find.
author: Lindt C.

description:
Ordered tonight via Uber Eats. The food was delicious and fresh. I got the Lazy Summer Roll (crab and mango wrapped in cucumber, no rice= no carb heaven!) and Spicy Scallop Roll (amazing and fresh!!)

I'm typically skeptical about ordering sushi for delivery because the fish can get warm.. etc. but this restaurant took so much care into packaging the meal. To paint a picture for you, they got scrappy and re-purposed some cardboard pieces in the bag to: 1. stabilize the boxes 2. separate the miso soup from the rolls so it wouldn't warm the fish. 

Super thoughtful! Very impressive and you can tell they care about the quality and their customers. Will be my go-to sushi delivery spot. Thanks Uber Eats and SQwers!!!
author: Cindy T.

description: I was very unhappy with the food I received this time around. The super dynamite roll was super soggy and the salmon rolls tasted old.
author: Alexandra D.

description:
Good food.   Good customer service. 
The owner Lee loves his customers and his job.   That love shows.
author: Alex R.

description:
Love that place! Reasonable priced and great quality! Love the people!

Nuff said, just go if ur around and feel like sushi and sake!
author: Ilias S.

description:
Great for veggie sushi, great for non-veggie sushi. Amazing staff, reasonable prices. 

Great place to watch football or basketball games.
author: Hem W.

description: I've only ordered delivery from them and it's always been good quality.  They once had a bad health score and that's mostly all I can say that's bad about it.  The meat quality isn't too great but you get what you paid for they aren't that expensive.
author: Doran I.

description:
I enjoyed the sushi but it took 2 hours for them to arrive (1.5 miles away). I could tell someone had tipped the food over because I found the wasabi and ginger underneath all of my sushi (it was not separated by anything at all). I learned this because my first bite filled my mouth with wasabi (which I don't use or like). 5-6 pieces were covered in wasabi out of the 3 rolls I ordered. 

The person delivering didn't use my delivery instructions so had to walk down and meet them, they were pleasant but didn't apologize.   Regardless if the delivery person knew exactly how long I'd been waiting, the restaurant had closed already so he had to know it had been a while.

Disappointed because so many people have rated highly and I am sure I would have enjoyed the sushi in the restaurant but can't vouch for the delivery.
author: Annette B.

description:
Quick delivery of excellent sushi!
Price point was great for the quality.  Sushi rice was within a reasonable range of firmness and temperature. Vege options were delicious.
author: M S.

description:
SQwers is a decent place for lunch and dinner. My friends and I order take out during hectic weeks and have no time to cook. It can get pretty crowded for dinner, just a heads up! The service here ranges. It took awhile for me to get my food the last time I came. 

They sometimes give you Miso Soup and sometimes don't. I order the Giants Roll which is shrimp tempura and cream cheese inside with smoked salmon and unagi outside. Some people don't like the idea of cream cheese in their sushi but it isn't that bad! Ask for some spicy mayo to dip with. The Gyoza (pork or vegetarian fried dumplings) is a good appetizer too. The Bento Box is reasonable and the portions are good. 

Because of their size, it's hard to accommodate big parties. This place takes reservations so it can be an option but I wouldn't recommend it.

 If you want a cheap quick bite, come to SQwers.
author: Breanna N.

description: Great food. Cool atmosphere. Top staff! And they do dinner deliver that is prompt. Love them! Also, they give free roll with a minimum order on deliveries (I think $35). If eating there for dinner, parking in front on Geary is not bad. Highly recommend them!
author: jey o.

description: Decided to try something new today and was not dissappointed. They are really affordable for lunch, with a bento speacial that is less than $10.  I ordered veggie tempura and salmon teriaki - very generous portions. Also, excellent miso soup (I like it salty)! Really has a neighborhood vibe that I find welcoming. Would come back again :)
author: Cecilia R.

description: I like their take out menu. They have delivery options which is convenient if you are at work. It is good enough to fill an appetite for an inexpensive price. The katsu plate is just right. No complaints about the taste and quality for the price.
author: Jaime F.

description: Not too great -- got their rainbow roll delivered and was pretty disappointed and ended up throwing most of it away. The imitation crab has WAY too much mayo and my stomach is not happy. Their salmon avocado roll wasn't as bad, luckily.
author: Danielle J.

description: Very tasty and extremely fast. We will be back! I had the Curry chicken nugget appetizer and highly recommend it. The miso soup was great and all the portions were generous.
author: Jon M.

description:
Found this sushi gem via the Amazon Restaurants app and boy am I so glad we ordered from here!

I HIGHLY recommend the Lone Mountain Roll that has spicy tuna topped with salmon poke, seaweed salad, and tempura flakes. Super delicious! 

We also ordered the Alaska Roll and both the salmon and avocado were perfectly prepared. BF ordered the rainbow roll that has different types of fish; super fresh. California roll was also really good and relatively cheap.
author: Shela D.

description: They close 15 minutes before the close time. Me and my toddler sone we're running in the rain to make it on time and 2:46 they wouldn't even accept to go order. Big disappointment. Horrible customer service!
author: Liliia R.

description: I was just traveling through SF and found this place. The sushi was great, the waiter spent most of his time counting receipts but the restaurant is so small  all you have to do is look over at him and he walks over to take your order. The box deal was good and filling at a cheap price of $10. I would recommend this place with the low price and good sushi.
author: Grayson S.

description:
Not a fan.
Ordered delivery last night, which came pretty quickly, and was correct.
Rice tasted and felt old and stale which was unpleasant.
The mix in the California roll is too wet for me.
And I got salmon avocado roll where the fish was hacked up and not very fresh tasting.
Wouldn't recommend.
author: Anna S.

description:
I ordered delivery and there wasn't much that was edible.
The soba noodles were mushy, and came with the worst smelling "wasabi" ever. It smelled like chemicals and petrol. The sauce it came with was too sweet. I took one bite of this order and set it aside. 

The sukiyaki was too salty, and they argued with me as to whether or not there were scallions in the soup (I asked for any onions or scallions to be left out). They said that what I think are scallions are leeks. It was clear they weren't going to side with me on this one, despite the fact that I have photos. The only edible part of this dish was the cellophane noodles. 

The tsukemono carrots also had that same chemical/petrol smell. The rest of the pickled veggies in this were underwhelming. The miso soup? Too salty and had scallions all over the place.
The steamed rice was good though... LOL!
author: Jen H.

description: I ordered the lunch special which consisted of the chicken katsu, salad, and sushi.  I also got a side order of beef tongue.  My chicken katsu wasn't cooked well and that says something especially since it's chicken.  I was disappointed with the food.  The customer service was good but the food quality wasn't there.  I've had way better sushi restaurants that I've gone too.  I ordered food delivery from here to and the sushi didn't taste fresh either.
author: Mikayla M.

description: Loved everything we ordered from this place!! Will order from here again!!! Golden gate roll, tempura calamari, chicken katsu, chicken teriyak to name a few!
author: Lissette T.

description: Quick and easy for me at work. Love all the staff. The waiters are both super funny and friendly. Love their miso soup!! Relatively inexpensive as well
author: Clayton N.

description:
If you live in the neighborhood, it's a not a bad place for a cheap quick bite. Nothing special though so don't come trekking across the city expecting a gourmet meal.

This is a good place for Americanized rolls and nigiri with generously sliced low to mid-level quality pieces of raw fish. With the right expectations, you'll have an enjoyable low key meal with friends here. I liked the cherry blossom roll and the yellowtail nigiri. Wished the spicy scallop roll had spicy mayo sauce on it instead of just dollops of sriracha. I also love grilled chicken hearts, so if you're a fan of innards like me (I grew up in Taiwan...don't judge!), this is your chance to get it for a mere $1. They also give you complimentary miso soup right after you settle in.

Service was fast and one of the waiters here (or is he the owner???) is super friendly and hilarious. 

Came here on a Sunday night around 8:30PM, and there were a few other diners but not crowded. Not sure if this place is busy during peak dining hours though.
author: Catherine C.

description: I ordered tonight thru uber eats and normally I do not like sushi delivery Bc the fish gets warm but it was so good tonight. My one year old gobbled up the avocado roll and some of the chicken nuggets and I had a lovely sushi mixed plate - I will totally order again and maybe even go in person though it's not my neighborhood.
author: Alison D.

description:
Had this for the first time last night, dinner. Was impressed with how neatly everything was packed, as it was a delivery order.

Everything was great: Miso, terriyaki chicken bento box, edamame, etc. The only let down was the Chicken and noodle Udon. The Chicken was really dry and lacking in flavor. 

Besides that, they were very prompt! I would definitely try this place again!
author: Jackie Z.

description:
Son's a USF student and recommended this place.  Very excited that we found our new favorite Japanese restaurant in San Francisco!  

 I had the lunch Bento box for $8.99 and the portions were so generous and very tasty!  We also had Sashimi which was so Fresh!  Hubby loved the Skewers which is their unique specialty.  

Mainly, the key to a good establshment is the service.  Our waiter, Crazy Simon made it 5 stars in our book.  We are definately coming back!  Bummed our son's already a senior, but glad we live close to SF.
author: Daphnie A.

description:
I don't typically write yelp reviews anymore, but this was astounding. Food 15 minutes late (already waited 75 minutes), I called to ask status and was gruffly told "within an hour." When I said "wait wait, that's unacceptable," I was (even more gruffly and dismissively) told by the man on the phone "look, it's really busy here." When I told I would cancel he a became verbally combative.

First review I've written in years, and you earned it, buddy. Never again.
author: Aiden B.

description: Salmon sashimi like butter - high quality fish, generous portions, fair price. Absolutely will order from here again.
author: Claire F.

description:
Came here on a weekday during the "lunch rush"... I was literally the only customer in the restaurant. I was directed to take a seat by the window, and given a menu. Free hot green tea is a great touch, and very good. You are also quickly presented with miso soup that, while tasty, was scaldingly hot. Stevie Wonder played in the background on the radio. I felt a little awkward. 

I decided on the $7.99 2-item lunch bento with a 4-piece Spicy Tuna Roll and Chicken Teriyaki. It also came with a scoop of white rice and a salad. The salad was pretty good, but the sushi seemed a bit tired and the chicken was very bland. It was good enough to eat, though, so it fulfilled that need. 

Service was nice enough in the beginning, but once a girl came in and put in a (reasonable) order for take-out, every ounce of energy (5 people there) went towards that. I sat for 10 minutes after finishing, waiting for the check, then ended up walking over and awkwardly standing near next to my server who was talking to the sushi chef until he finally took notice of me. Remember, I'm the only customer actually in the restaurant. I was still feeling a little awkward. 

The food wasn't memorable, but the (lack) of service unfortunately was. I won't return here in the future.
author: Laura B.

description:
YUM! 

Everything here is amazing, super tasty !

Perfectly cooked in super good sauces. 

I'm sad my boyfriend and I won't be able to come more often!
author: Kierra K.

description: Great place to hangout, especially during a Warriors game! Fresh sushi and welcoming service. I am strictly gluten free and they were very accommodating. I had nigiri, avocado, cucumber slices and an awesome time!!!
author: Cristal G.

description:
Have gotten delivery from here a few times, and it was okay. But this last time really bumped it down for me.

Long story short(er), around 1pm I ordered salmon teriyaki + gyoza for lunch. It arrived at 2:30PM. Quoted estimate was between 45-60 minutes, which is fine, but it was literally for the minimum amount of $ and I gave a 20% tip up front, so an hour and a half is too long. I also ordered and paid for a couple extra sauces, and they forgot the one I really wanted - extra teriyaki sauce for my salmon. If you're gonna take an hour and a half to get lunch over, please remember everything I paid for and deliver it kind of warm.

I had gotten the salmon teriyaki before and it was decent, but this time it was really fishy and tasted spoiled. Actually, one of the two pieces was okay, the other tasted completely different, which freaked me out a bit and I tossed it. Pork gyoza was soggy, but I think it would have been good if it was hot, since the flavors and proportions were good.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Well, the water was good.

Otherwise, the food was poor (wife and I got katsu don and gyu don), and the service was bad (calling out for the check multiple times with no one responding).

The gyu don was so off that I sent it back, which the server was not polite about.  After taking it away, he proceeded to eat my food from the back of the restaurant, as if to say "see, it's fine!"  When he finally brought our check, at least he didn't charge us, but there was no apology.

Never again.
author: Corey C.

description: Sushi is always scrumptious and the wait time for delivery is never too long. I always order a ton when I come here and I have yet to be disappointed!
author: Brittany W.

description: Came here on Easter and it was pretty empty. I've been craving for sushi and this place is awesome! We got beef teriyaki, salmon, dynamite roll, and winter wonderland! I loved every single item that we got. The sushi was very fresh and you can really taste it. Customer service was spectacular! Will be returning soon whenever I crave for sushi! Yumm
author: Tina C.

description:
Great service, very attentive. I had the miso soup, Sunomuno, and 10 piece chef choice sashimi. All were yummy and had beautiful presentation.

Ordered the bens roll and lion king to go.
Portions were small and just ok, I'm sure if I had eaten them freshly made I'd like it more. Maybe I should have ordered the skewers.
author: Jilly C.

description:
For a place called SQwers, I was expecting them to offer more skewers. Granted, I ordered delivery and didn't go into the restaurant to eat, but they only offered about one or two skewer options for delivery. We ordered through Eat24.

June 2013
*Chicken karage ($6.99) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco-2?select=vqI5qXSp18rCLg7l_1VJSA#vqI5qXSp18rCLg7l_1VJSA
*Lunch bento box (Chicken & Salmon teriyaki) $7.99 http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco-2?select=vqI5qXSp18rCLg7l_1VJSA#5kpXs6sNgTz2iDzn_K8Pjw
*Miso soup for Lunch bento box http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco-2?select=vqI5qXSp18rCLg7l_1VJSA#WcG5TrpOjRTAH7BikNFnGw
*Los locos wings ($5.99) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco-2?select=vqI5qXSp18rCLg7l_1VJSA#HHEE7PpG7VVJn0qwqmJ0bw
*Pork gyoza ($4.99) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco-2?select=vqI5qXSp18rCLg7l_1VJSA#KPB0gNEpVPNhHAErUE3InA
*Seaweed salad ($3.50) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco-2?select=vqI5qXSp18rCLg7l_1VJSA#JfNabxF7YzA2fJak9bO08g
*Uni ($7.99), Amaebi ($7.99) & Hamachi ($3.99) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco-2?select=vqI5qXSp18rCLg7l_1VJSA#Hler2lzONG4U0VqwSW8aAw
*Yaki ika ($5.99) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco-2?select=vqI5qXSp18rCLg7l_1VJSA#uvQCsWgVUXGxqVKIPtgBFg
*Godzilla (free w/any order $60 or more), Amaebi heads ($7.99) & Spicy tuna roll ($5.99) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco-2?select=vqI5qXSp18rCLg7l_1VJSA#Q-7BOo4p_U6y2z-DKWnCrw

Eh, everything was alright. Nothing tasted amazing nor was it bad. The karaage was crunchy. The ika could have used a little more char. The wings weren't what I was expecting. Very wet and mushy. One thing to note is that the bento box was called Chicken & Salmon teriyaki. But you get chicken teriyaki and salmon sashimi. Not what the roommate was expecting, but it was fine.

Therefore, you get an average review where nothing stood out or totally turned me off. So is the nature of some 3 star reviews. Everything was just A-OK.
author: Elena N.

description:
This fairly unassuming place looks like an izakaya (drinking place with drinking food) and delivers exactly that. Food is both good quality and cheap, with classic grill foods, skewers and small plates. 

We were happy to see that it had some of our favourites from Japan's izakayas like flavoured shochu, chicken & leek and chicken skin skewers. It's also naturally good for vegetarians with traditional fried/silken tofu dishes, grilled veg skewers, tempura, etc.

The sashimi was very fresh compared to some similarly priced places in Japantown, and we noticed there were plenty of fun and inventive sushi rolls with names like 'lion king roll' and 'screaming roll' for those who like Californian style. 

The atmosphere inside is friendly, with handwritten boards and food specials named after locals. Service is more Japanese than American, you might have to wave for service at busy times but this is natural as it's expected you will order more drinks and small plates throughout an evening. 

If you order takeaway, it is mostly sushi so you may be missing out on the grill menu and atmosphere.
author: Heather O.

description: My favorite sushi place in town, everything is so delicious and the service is extremely nice
author: Anna P.

description: Yo this place is the shit! The food is fantastic, the drinks are amazing, and the service is awesome! If I could give more stars I would.
author: Daniel M.

description:
This place goes off so hard!! What makes it is the ambiance- the owner Lee, and his trusty sidekick Simon, always make you feel right at home. The sushi is second to none, with new specials coming out all the time. They also make their own infused sake here, which is to die for- try the ghost pepper sake if you dare!! Warriors games are always on, as these guys are big fans. I love my local neighborhood sushi spot, and recommend to all!!
-Khan
author: Matt B.

description: Would give a zero but this place really isn't good after starting to eating notice the food safety rating :(( ordered lunch bento box temporal was greasy and over cooked chicken burnt not happy
author: Marlo M.

description:
Home.

If ever there were an establishment that made you feel at home, Sqwers would be that place. It's unassuming and spartan in both locale and decor. But for what it might "lack" in flash it makes up for in a truly warm dining (and drinking) experience. 

The fish is great. It's exactly what you want. Healthy cuts, solid sashimi etc... The rolls are elaborate. I recommend the one's on the wall, particularly the Gunter roll. The Chef's Sashimi Sampler is on point and comes served on a cool ice box. Get that with a roll or two and your in business.

The sake and beer flows heavily here. Ask to try some of the home brew. You won't be sorry. 

All of that is great. But what makes this place my go to eating establishment 3 times a week in a city with hundreds of incredible options, is Simon and Mr. Lee. I'm not sure you will encounter better service anywhere.

Five hard earned stars. Would and do consistently recommend to anyone and everyone.
author: Bryan D.

description: Awesome service and delicious sushi!!! Came here with high expectations and left with them being met! Sushi is fresh & presentation is amazing!
author: Julie H.

description: I have ordered here multiple times and generally think there food is good and on time. Tonight in the poring rain one of there drivers essentially yelled at me to come outside to get my food, while I told him How to dial into my building so I didn't have to go outside. Then to top it off he gave me a nasty look as he handed my food off that I paid In the app a pre-tip to this AHOLE For!!!!!!!! Last time I order from this place.
author: Michael S.

description:
I went here for dinner with a couple of friends. I ordered the bento box dinner with Tonkatsu and Tempura. We got miso soup on the house but not really since its supposed to come with the bento box dinner anyways. I thought the portion sizes were large. The bento box didn't come in a box but on a plate. The Tonkatsu was nicely fried and crispy. The tempura was good but I think the potato was slightly undercooked. I also shared a Godzilla roll. I thought it was pretty good. I liked how the roll was presented on the plate. I was completely stuffed and had to take home the left overs.    

There were plenty of seats during dinner. Service was ok. My water glass was never empty. The wait staff tried taking my miso soup away when I wasn't finished with it. They should have asked first or waited until the bowl was completely empty. I was going to box my rice with my leftovers but they took my rice away while they were cleaning the table.
author: Alexander L.

description:
I love this place. The sushi is fresh and delicious, and the service is absolutely fantastic. Oh, and the price? You can't beat it in SF. I love sashimi, and their combo is always on point. The rolls are unique and tasty. Try the Baked Mussels, they won't disappoint. And obviously try some skewers! The shrimp/bacon is delicious, the fried chicken skin is great, and on an on the list goes. 

This place isn't fancy. But it does it's job right.
author: Jane F.

description:
Not much to say as it was not my call for picking this place. The food is very average. The rolls are not very good, the tempura was not great. You know you are in trouble when it is surimi they serve instead of real crab.

But what the heck they do deliver and delivery was quick. Add bonus of free rolls with certain amount of purchase...even though those rolls really werent good.
author: David G.

description:
Combo lunch and dinners are value meals. 
Small unassuming dining space  but may be cold with each door opening during the winter. 
Seems to mainly cater to the local USF crowd. 
Large sushi menu. Staff very courteous and friendly.  Nice service. Note: staff can be very loud sometimes either with chatter amongst themselves or with regulars . This mars the mood and can be jarring to the dining experience for those of us who are not part of the college crowd. Large tv monitor has sports on at all times and may explain identity.
author: E W.

description:
Just had dinner here and had a blast:

Service was awesome, server was super chill, gave good recommendations on food, and brought out some stuffs on the house.

Food was pretty good...definitely worth it

Sake was bomb...and host/manager brought out a free bottle for us, which was very generous

Food + awesome ppl running the place means im comin back
author: Paiman V.

description: Neighborhood Japanese,  run by Chinese restaurant.  This reminds me of Americanized Japanese combo very common dinner.  Sometimes I just like that combination, miso soup, rice , spicy tuna sushi, grilled salmon salad.  What's missing is the green tea ice cream, but you can't have everything.   Miso soup was good with plenty of seaweed and tofu, not overly salty.  Spicy tuna wasn't spicy, whicht is the only selection that had sashimi.  Grilled salmon had a nice crispy skin attached.  Everything was a good portion.  I am not a fan of bento box themselves; all the dishes came separately.  Salad was fresh with dressing, not so vinegary.   Dining was enjoyable, nice atmosphmere to chat and catch up, hang out place, of course this was a weeknight.  We ordered one skewer of gizzard and 2 hearts for $1.00 each.  yum.  Green tea was served complimentary.   Nice service.  Big TV for those fans of basketball.
author: Helen L.

description:
I hate to give poor reviews but unfortunately, this has to be done. 

As another Yelper has mentioned, food here is in no way memorable. 
We came in during lunch to give it a try & left pretty disappointed. 
DON'T get the pork ramen - it looks NOTHING like the one they have pictured in their menu! 
Also gave their chicken heart skewers a try & there was nothing special about those either. 

The only mediocre item is their donbari bowl (I think that's what it was called?). 

Such an unumpressive experience overall that I don't even remember...
author: Sylvia N.

description:
Straightforward sushi place with a large tv, which is great for NFL/NBA games.

This place serves tasty sushi, but you must micromanage the chefs/serving crew if you are particular about your food. For example, we don't like our sushi slathered in mayo and sauces, so be sure to communicate this. 

Dishes to get include crazy roll, albacore tataki, and spider roll. Ironically I wouldn't get the skewers as they were underwhelming compared to other places I've been to (meat isn't marinated and the skewers relied heavily on sauces).

I'd come back again for the rolls and the great service though.
author: Lee T.

description:
It's been a while since I've reviewed this restaurant, so decided I should post an update. 

The service continues to make this a truly special place. Simon, Lee, and the entire staff go out of their way to make you feel at home. They are the reason I've continued coming back for birthdays & events, or using their assortment of sakes to get my night started on many of my nights out (that's me holding the bottle).  

The food is homey Japanese food - great skewers, noodles, sushi & sashimi. If you stay late enough you can even grab a bite with some of the kitchen staff and enjoy some tasty rice & vegetable bowls. 

Special note - if you're looking for a place to host a birthday party & have a blast with friends, give Simon & Lee some advanced notice. They'll make sure you're treated right with plenty of drinks flowing & access to the speakers so you can DJ your own party.
author: Daniel L.

description:
This is my favorite place to go for both a local lunch and dinner! I lived a block away from it last year and it was the best discovery I ever made. It's convenient and fairly priced - and I love to come in and sit down, order take out, and even call in for delivery if I happen to be at school or anywhere else.

The service here is wonderful and all the servers are so much fun and great company to have around! They really make this place wonderful! I enjoy their specials, their combo boxes and everything about it. I would order anything and everything on the menu!
author: Amy N.

description:
Was in the mood for a Bento Box & so we're my co-workers.
Was searching through the EAT24 app and this place had 4 star's with a $8.99 Bento Box.
I ordered the Chicken Teriyaki w/ Veggie Tempura, it was pretty good came w/ Miso soup as well.
I will be ordering from here in the future.
author: D M.

description:
Sqwers is a smaller restaurant located a couple of blocks west of Masonic in the Inner Richmond area.  Our party of five came here for a celebration of a co-worker/friend's promotion.  We brought three bottle of wine and they helped open and pour the wine for us.  The best part is that they don't charge any corkage fee!  Easily $45 to $60 anywhere else.  

Hearing that their sashimi and sushi was very good, that's what we ordered.  They even offered complementary edaname and miso soup. 
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco?select=gy1cl6JTD4G_AWr306zP7Q#gy1cl6JTD4G_AWr306zP7Q) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco?select=gy1cl6JTD4G_AWr306zP7Q#UN67A2GLeIrwKzLFiv6I0g)

Hamachi sashimi - nice generous slices of hamachi.  Very good.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco?select=gy1cl6JTD4G_AWr306zP7Q#884ptEbDJdRfp6VmwX4Myw)

Sake sashimi and Hamachi belly sashimi - chef said the salmon was super fresh and yes, it was.  Never had Hamachi belly and it was tasty.  
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco?select=gy1cl6JTD4G_AWr306zP7Q#-EzIXMEiX0nF8fzryYS0qQ)

Albacore sashimi and Albacore belly sashimi - Albacore was good, but I preferred the Hamaichi.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco?select=gy1cl6JTD4G_AWr306zP7Q#eQ8xUv39yRE3ZhXHBryWaw)

Dragon Roll - (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco?select=gy1cl6JTD4G_AWr306zP7Q#fyj-lLRr7mvKcDK6NURXZg)

Caterpillar Roll - (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco?select=gy1cl6JTD4G_AWr306zP7Q#ZPtuYG7TOMSLXfg605I_yA)

Unagi Sushi - (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco?select=gy1cl6JTD4G_AWr306zP7Q#9n6jQ4usXs2zNZPh534fYA)

Ika Roll - First time trying the squid roll.  Was actually very tasty.  
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco?select=gy1cl6JTD4G_AWr306zP7Q#8-IEJz5tVqP7T7lAik5BtQ) 
Hamachi Kama - Perfectly grilled.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco?select=gy1cl6JTD4G_AWr306zP7Q#nkzvbJZWh4nMUrkks1-vJw)

Agedashi - (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco?select=gy1cl6JTD4G_AWr306zP7Q#WIOLlLoRR4UcBD2ltvxxew)

The wait staff was friendly and service was very good.  Simon, one of the owners, was super friendly and came by and poured us complementary sake from three different bottles.  As Simons says, "Happy", "Happy", "Happy"!  We had a great time with the delicious food and friendly service.  One of the better sushi restaurants in the Richmond District. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco?select=gy1cl6JTD4G_AWr306zP7Q#GhvHGZmYmEMMRRSWLNjtZw) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sqwers-izakaya-and-sushi-bar-san-francisco?select=gy1cl6JTD4G_AWr306zP7Q#V2-HSsryvexjJeeD70HrZA)
author: Al L.

description:
Last minute we all decided we HAD TO HAVE sushi.  We stopped around Japantown and found a sushi restaurant that did not look appetizing (we will leave the name out, because, to each their own), so we took to Yelp to find a different sushi place not far from where we were.  

The restaurant is quite small, but I've learned to always look past that.  There's nothing fancy about it either, but it is VERY clean and simple.  

The food:  MY GOSH!  There's so much to choose from and it was all delicious!  We order sushi and gyoza.  The rolls we tried were: dragon, mango, and lemon salmon.  The dragon was so good that we ordered another.  Everything we had was mouthwatering yummy.  We will definitely come back for sure! 

The other great thing is if you live around the area the deliver.  YES!!!  I am craving it so badly that I may order it tonight.  :). Enjoy!!!
author: Melissa P.

description:
I was unfortunately disappointed by this restaurant. Reading the other reviews, I had expected higher quality food. I came here to try out the lunch special, and started my meal excited by the cheap price of $8. 

I ordered a teriyaki salmon and vegetable tempura combo. The teriyaki salmon was a tad bland, overcooked yet lacking in flavor. The vegetable tempura was over-battered and tasted as if the oil they fried it in was old.

My mother ordered the teriyaki beef and chicken katsu. The chicken katsu was fine, overly-coated but normal. The teriyaki beef however, was to put it plainly, putrid. It tasted as if the beef was spoiled. The owner was kind enough to replace it with another item of our choice, but it was difficult to remove the taste from our mouths.

While the price of the food is cheap and portions are reasonable, I don't think I would be able to bring myself to visit again considering the teriyaki beef. The owner was extremely friendly and hospitable through our entire visit however, warranting the third star to the review. (Most likely closer to 2.5 stars, I still cringe at the thought of how that beef tasted)
author: Michael L.

description:
Lee, Simon and Janice... where to start?  the actual sqwers on the menu is just the beginning. such a large variety of food to choose from.  Incredibly fresh sashimi.  And the portions are pretty big.  Specialty rolls?  They have some of the best around and a large selection.  The sake flows throughout the meal.  I followed Lee from another restaurant that I used  to go to.  Truth is I only went there because of Mr. Lee.  Always in a good mood and sometimes he will even help ya get into the cheersing mood if you catch my drift.   But even with the positive energy of mr Lee its nothing compared to when you add Simon to the mix.  The 2 of them together and every dining experience becomes a festive party.  they love to interact with their customers and really love their restaurant.  you would think that would be enough for 5 stars. but then there is Janice.  Shes the hostess with the mostest.  she loves to have fun like Simon and Lee and keeps an eye on all the customers making sure they are all happy and being taken care of. 

Geary  blvd has become the place in the city to get some great food and Sqwers is definitely one of the top ones. give it a try, order the chicken skins, a couple specialty rolls, fresh sashimi and some sake and join in on the party.
author: eric t.

description: This place is amazing! The staff is so nice and the prices are reasonable. It's a neighborhood casual kind of spot where they remember you and you can watch the game.
author: Roni B.

description:
If I lived in town, I would eat here all the time.  It's a little short on ambiance...they have printouts of menu items tacked to the walls.  But, the service and food were great.  Given the activity for the to go orders, I would say it was fairly popular.

I had the lunch bento box.  The portions were generous and the food was great.
author: Janet W.

description: I noticed that there were a few recent negative reviews, but decided to give them a try anyways! I AM SO PLEASANTLY SURPRISED!! I ordered 20 bento boxes for lunch delivery in an office for a business meeting, and everyone raved about the food! The food came in on time, hot, fresh, and the delivery guy even helped me set up! I will be using them again for future lunches! They definitely deserve another chance!  THANK YOU!
author: Shelly P.

description:
The SO and I were running around looking for a place to eat during one of these busy festival days and had to go further and further away from the epicenter of said-festival. We finally saw this place and honestly, I was relatively skeptical about whether or not I was going to like this place but alas, SQwers has completely won me over.

First things first, service is perfectly fine. Yes, the man helping you is curt but I've noticed that he's the only one actually manning all the tables. The other guy there, I believe is their delivery person and only fills water. I don't think there was anything wrong with his service, he just provides what you need. It may be a cultural issue that you are experiencing if you thought the man was rude.

Now onto the food. Their price point is relatively low for what they serve. I think the nirgiri and the yakitori was well worth the money. Now to be fair, I didn't spend a lot of time with their sashimi/raw items because yes, I am a sushi snob and would be fearful to do it and because bento boxes were cheaper and at the moment, I felt like having a "cheap meal".

There is a nice reason to dine-in, which is there are signs all over the place for the specials (such as their $1 yakitori sticks!) and their lesser-known fish nigiris (whelkfish and needlefish, whatwhat!).

Their skewers were not the best I've ever had, but the best I've definitely ever had for $1! The insanity! There was a good selection, lacking for an Izakaya but good enough for a sushi restaurant. The nigiris were relatively good, not much I can say about this one as I've never had whelkfish or needlefish before.

The bento box, while a good value, had some major issues. The fish was severely overdone and so was the pork. It's as if someone had accidentally left it on the stove too long but I feel like that's an easily remedied problem.

All in all, I would still suggest SQwers (which doesn't actually have that many yakitori items) for a quick and relatively cheap sushi meal!
author: Winè C.

description:
In an effort to avoid a last-minute birthday disaster, we called up SQwers and asked if they could accommodate 11 people on short notice. They could. 

Everyone liked the food, and the service was great as usual. 

The accommodation also involved a lot of sake. And home-made spicy sake, which I cannot recommend.
author: Rob R.

description: Amazing!!! For a small place this place delivers everything; You get great atmosphere: great food and amazing  service. They gave us free sake just because! Come with friends! Free miso too!!!!
author: Carter G.

description:
Another one of these small hole in the semi -sushi places.  I was brought there by a family member who found it to be a cheap place in the neighborhood.  Found a parking space right in front, but was grossed out because the other car parked right in front of the place had bird crap all over it and around the sidewalk.

Suddenly what little appetite I had was gone.

This is one of those places where there is a big menu of all kinds of selections, but then there are little signs all over the place with their specials.  I decided to keep it simple with sashimi over rice.  Others had tempura and other sushi selections.

The service was very personal as there was only one other family there with a little kid who ate mini hot dog weenies with a toothpick (so I guess you can say they are kid friendly).

In the end, the price was right, the sushi and rolls were just okay and I give it the 2nd star just for the personable service. I'd say that if you want sushi, aren't a sushi snob and don't care about ambiance, and don't believe sushi should be really expensive, then this is the neighborhood sushi place for you.  This place just didn't make me want to come back for anything.  There are lots of other sushi places along Geary that I'd rather go to for just-okay sushi experiences.
author: Erik H.

description:
Skewed.

Two skewers of grilled chicken for $4.99 was a great deal. Plenty of poultry with a flavorful marinade. Simple and enjoyable.

Five pieces of an assorted fish with mango roll for $10.99 was not. Menu said eight pieces. Staff said no mayo. Both were incorrect.

Looking past my disdain for mayo it made the cucumber wrapped creation soggy. Unexpected miso soup was nice but didn't save the third star.

Can't fault the friendly staff or the subdued energy as it was a Sunday afternoon. With all the positive reviews imagine it gets lively later and other menu items are better.

But my rating skews towards two stars.
author: Jason B.

description:
AWESOME service. The staff was super friendly and welcoming and just down to have fun. 
Great sake (watch out for the one infused with chili, not for the faint of heart).
I thought the sushi was just ok, but everything else totally made up for it. 

Would definitely go back!
author: Marilyn M.

description: The sushi rolls r so good. My fav includes super dynamite, winter wonderland, and lion king. The super dynamite is not soggy like other places that ive had fried rolls before, despite being delivered. I didnt like the spicy scallop roll cause it was kinda tasteless.
author: Jenny N.

description: I just ordered delivery and the warm items were almost cold plus they delivered the wrong soda. I called to see if they could swap out our sodas, but he refused...said I lived too far away. Terrible customer service and sushi is just average. Will be my last order.
author: Jaime J.

description: ordered delivery and took almost 2 hours to get to my apartment, which is only a 10 minute drive away. I understand it's raining out... but still. The food is okay, but luke warm. The only reason for 3 stars is the kind delivery driver who was very apologetic at the door.
author: Madeline S.

description: Amazing service. Clears dishes immediately and constantly refills water and beer. Even drinks with us and does sake bombs with us. Good matches perfectly with the alcohol. Great time with a group and wanna just drinks and relax.
author: Christopher L.

description:
Great service, great prices, and portions. 

Good lunch bento menu. It's cheap, like 8 bucks. 

Even better for dinner, more portion but $13. Still good though. 
Good stuff for dinner combo: Chicken katus, tonkatsu, salmon teriyaki, and california roll.

Good sushi:
Goldengate Roll, 
Lion King Roll, and
Super Dynamite Roll

Other good stuff:
Their fried salmon and chicken karage.
author: Cristian R.

description:
Sqwers Izakaya doesn't have skewers or izakaya on it's menu. questioned the waitress. she's says it's not ready yet. Huh?

rest of the menu is regular japanese entrees, nigiri, appetizers. strange the sushi dispay case is empty of fish. all the prep is done in the kitchen  out of sight.

eats: lunch special bento box, katsu chicken & sashimi (7.99)
-miso soup: all msg, couldn't finish it.
 -salad: nice, better than average
-sake sashimi, 3 pieces, fresh, better than average
-katsu chicken: tender, thin, nice crust, not too juicy, not much meat. cut too thin.

temaki:
-didn't see any diners at lunch, all take out
-food seems average or better than average
-3 stars since no izakaya is available.
-tea refilled twice.
author: Victor G.

description:
I'm pretty jazzed, a new place opened up today in the old Red Wings spot that has been closed for 9 months.  So even though my wife is cokking a nice dinner right now, I stopped in for a quick bite to check it out.  I'm extra jazzed because the business filing that was done a few months ago indicated that a Domino's pizza was going in there - this is so much better.

Since we were going to have a late dinner, I didn't want to get too much.  So I ordered the Miso Soup, Tobiko sushi, and Maguro sashimi.  Service was quick and friendly, the place was sparkling clean, and the decor was nicely done and not too much.

The food was fresh and well prepared - Miso can sometime be too bland or too salty.  This was just right (to my taste anyway).  The Tobiko has a nice flavor and crunch to it and the Maguro was very fresh.

I'll definately be coming back for a full dinner very soon - and maybe even an occasional lunch.
author: Jeff H.

description:
Bento box is a value! Fast service and clean. 

Could do without handwritten paper specials on wall! Makes the place look cheapy! 


Decor is nice and seating is ample. 


Parking is meter or street parking on cross streets.
author: Shima L.

description: Good place for quick, cheap, not high quality sushi. My friend and I came in on Saturday afternoon around 1pm looking for a quick bite- we ordered a spicy salmon roll , sashimi, and agedashi tofu. The food was good for the price. Totally serviceable- no frills, nothing special. The salmon did look a bit gray and it didn't taste very fresh. That said we only paid $25 for the meal so if you come here you're getting what you pay for.
author: Sarem G.

description:
Id recommend: cherry blossom and lion king roll.
This has turned into my go to sushi spot so I've tried most of the things on their menu, and you honestly cant go wrong. I've never had a bad roll :)
Green tea is great. And miso soup is complimentary!

P.S. - GREAT SERVICE AND PLENTY OF PARKING! WOOP WOOP!
author: Yana B.

description:
I live just a block away and this is my go to lunch/ dinner spot when my lazy self does not want to go too far for food. I've lived next to it for quite some time and I come back for the great priced food and even better service. 

I only decided to write a review now after months of coming to this place because the owner, after hearing I had fallen sick, packed a large container of hot green tea for me to take home with me. I thought it was extremely thoughtful. Every time I am here they are above and beyond service and I think they should really be recognized by that. It's a very home-y vibe.

Many of the complaints I see on yelp is that the teriyaki is too bland. The teriyaki is lightly sauced but I prefer it this way. If you like it more sauced than I advise you to ask for extra sauce. Other than that, I see no other complaints about anything. 


Definitely stop by for that great hospitality and amazing sushi rolls!
author: Melissa V.

description: 3.5 stars rounded up!  If you are at the City Target/Best Buy shopping center, this place is just a few blocks West on Geary for a good solid Japanese meal.  We enjoyed their lunch bento box where you get 2 choices of the main portions plus miso soup, salad and rice for $7.99 - tasty and great value!  My bf and I both got the salmon teriyaki (tasty, a tad bit overcooked but forgiveable), chicken katsu (my bf thoroughly enjoyed this, said it was better than the chicken katsu at a place close to home) and sashimi (slices were a bit thicker than I am used to but I had no complaints about that - more sashimi for me!).  Service was friendly, attentive and would come by often to fill our hot tea cups.
author: Maile N.

description:
Great service, great people, and love their sushi. The restaurant is a bit hidden because of the big tree blocking but that didn't stop me from coming in! 

Favorite rolls: 
Mango tango roll
Dynamite roll
Cherry blossom
Red and white 

Each roll was very unique and flavorful! Definitely will come back!
author: Kim C.

description:
The fish quality is decent, but the wait times for delivery are unacceptable. 

I waited for 1.5 hours to get the soggiest, blandest tempura I've ever had. No apology, driver was super rude. I'm not eating here again.
author: Robert B.

description: Place is great good food amazing service! I eat here at least once a month. Sake is on point! I would highly recommend this place. The owner is a great guy as well.
author: Gerard B.

description:
I can't even.

Textbook case of misleading YELP ratings.   I ordered delivery from here after seeing a solid 4 star rating (beef terikyaki bento.)  I was excited, but right when I opened the bento, I knew it was going to take a miracle to make what I saw inside actually taste edible.  

The beef teriyaki was pale grey with a pathetic, watery coating of teriyaki sauce.  I bit into the beef and immediately could tell that it was either spoiled, old or not properly refrigerated.  Immediately threw it away.
author: Clarissa P.

description:
I've been disillusioned by a lot of the sushi places in the inner Richmond... Usually stale but cheap fish... I guess you get what you pay for...  

This place just opened down the street from me and we decided to try it... The fish was fresh and fantastic... I maybe lazy or generous but man, try this place out... Lee and Simon are the nicest hosts I've met...

This is a nice add to our neighborhood AND it's cheap... We need restaurants with personality... I see a new weekend haunt for me... 

I'm a little bit sad I didn't try the heart...
author: Nathan D.

description:
Food was priced fairly but service was ultra slow when we had late lunch here. One man handling phone orders, delivers, and serving customers doesn't cut it. 

We were desperate for lunch and found this place on yelp. Sushi was good but not fully satisfying.
author: Winnie L.

description: Got my food delivered on time which is always a plus! However, I ordered Gyu Don, Oshinko, and Calamari Tempura. The beef in the Gyu Don was dry and some parts of the rice were hard. The Oshinko was not what I was expecting (Oshinko roll), it was two pieces of Oshinko on a piece of rice wrapped with nori . The calamari tempura was a-ok. Miso soup was delish! Overall, fast delivery, ok-food, 3 stars.
author: Dayna Y.

description:
Favorite Yakitori place in SF! It isn't the fanciest Yakitori place but the food's great and affordable. Most importantly the service is ***** stars. Servers are extremely accommodating and outgoing. I always have a great time when I come here! 

***make sure you ask your waiter/server to take down a sake bomb with you***
author: Emily N.

description: This is such a hidden gem but I'm so glad I got told about this spot! Currently one of my top favorite sushi spots! Came here twice and people here are so friendly and funny. Services here are very welcoming and attentive as well. On to the food, everything I tried was so delicious. Especially the lion king roll, it was superb! Their food presentation are very nice as well! Definitely recommending this spot and give it a try! I promise you won't be disappointed!
author: Joey L.

description: Super friendly place. Had miso soup fast. Simon threw in an appetizer to. Had 2 combo plates and daughters had 3 different rolls, chicken was great. Lots of food. Bill came to only $74.00 with beer and soda. I had a 22 oz beer they brought me one more on the house and also filled glass again after that. The place is loud but food is great. If I was a local this would be a regular stop
author: Kelly B.

description:
My new go-to place! Wait time for Sunday lunch was super easy, got seated right away. Loved that our server was so happy to hear my boyfriend respond "wonderful!" when he asked how we were doing. He laughed and responded with "I love that!"  

We split 3 rolls - the jeff roll, the super dynamite, and winter wonderland. All were delicious and filling, and reasonably priced compared to other sushi restaurants. My only complaint is that the server never came with our check so we ended up walking to the counter to pay. Wish we received an explanation or apology but it seemed like he was bothered by something else.
author: Jamie B.

description: This is local's hole in the wall place. It had good food, good sushi, good price, and comical owner who liked to engage with the guest. We enjoyed this place.
author: Timothy B.

description:
Good quick delivery in Laurel Heights, solid sushi, miso soup was a highlight. And, they throw in a free California roll with a $30 purchase.

Weirdly there is no izakaya, despite the name.
author: Andrew K.

description: Ordered delivery and was told 45 min.  Over an hour went by and still nothing.  I spent the entire time calling and the line was busy. I finally got a hold of Janet who was rude and told me they were simply busy and couldn't help me... Will NEVER order here again... Very poor customer service and don't talk to Janet.
author: Veronika Z.

description:
This place won't let you down. The service is great, the owners are awesome and always try to make you feel welcomed. The food is pretty good. For the price, the quality is great. That said, it's not fancy, it's not pretentious, and it very much caters to their clientele. 

I come here at least once a month. I've ordered take out and had them delivered. Love this place, they never failed me. I love getting their chef choice sashimi, and maybe a small roll as well or an app. Their tofu is pretty tasty. All their food is really good and delicious, and I haven't had anything I'm not a fan of. 

Overall, this is a place I decided to give my business to continuously. It's one of those place we (SO and I) bring friends over to, or go as a couple, or even individually.
author: Katia T.

description:
4 stars for our sweet waiter who amusingly and obviously supports chivalry, as evidenced by saying "Ladies first!" when getting our order and very purposely putting the bill in front of my boyfriend rather than in the middle or anywhere near me. 

3 stars for the food.

I ordered the Cherry Blossom roll (mango, albacore, unagi top with salmon and tobiko spicy mayo). I expected it to have a lot of flavor but found it lacking and boring to my tastebuds. 

Dinner combo was a good but not delicious and very reasonable for the price of $13. Combo included your choice of 2 items (we got the shrimp/vegetable tempera which was a good size and chicken katsu).
author: Emily C.

description: I have been to this Sushi Bar a couple times before and the food is pretty good. And I tried ordering online for delivery on Eat24, and it went really bad. I waited almost 2 hours for my food which was cold by the time it gets here. When I called them, they won't answer the phone which made me very disappointed about this restaurant.
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
I have been coming here since the restaurant has opened and the quality of the food has been diminishing since. The reason I give it a 1 star is because the owner is incredibly rude. 

I ordered niku udon only to receive niku don (the rice bowl). This happened over three times over the course of a month. On the third occurrence, I kindly called in to tell them of the miscommunication, only to be yelled at by the manager (the guy with the pony tail). He was extremely angry for some reason and even begin to swear.

Never going back there again.
author: C J.

description:
My go-to place for the best chicken-katsu. They do not skimp out on the chicken, and seems like their katsu is fresh to order because it's sizzling when it comes out! Great crunch, great tenderness in the chicken, and the quantity is awesome for a college kid on a budget! I always have enough for a leftover meal the next day. 

I've never seen this place super packed, but regardless, the service is great. Everything comes out in a timely manner and everyone seems happy all the time. They do have a lot of visitors visiting the chefs and managers, which gives off a family friendly vibe. One night, my roommate said everyone from the restaurant was just pushing them some free alcohol, which is never a bad thing. 

Chicken Katsu is a MUST get here.
author: Sheri N.

description: It's OK.. I ordered the tuna poke and it was literally cubed tuna with cucumber and a lil sriracha... Bland, no flavor and a really fishy.. I know it's fishy but that... Can tell it wasn't fresh... Maybe I should have stuck with sushi.
author: Keeks P.

description: The lion king and seaweed salad were good but the chicken teriyaki wasn't so good the chicken was a hard textur like beef.
author: Amarachi O.

description:
I came here with a couple of my friends from college who are out of town and the waiter was so nice and accommodating to us! He was extremely friendly and made sure our table was well taken care of! 

I am a very picky eater and I love sushi and the waiter insisted that I can customize my rolls! Usually, restaurants would never offer to customize your orders until you ask, but I was amazed at the service here. 

Our table ordered eight rolls and a chicken plate and everything tasted great. The food came out without much of a wait except the chicken but the waiter kept apologizing for the wait. 

I had a great time here all because of the amazing service and I would definitely come back again! Good food combined with great service will definitely bring customers back again and again!
author: Maybo L.

description: My favorite Japanese delivery!!! Awesome food for a great price! Quick delivery too! Love the tonkatsu and their sushi!
author: Dayna Y.

description:
I am hesitant to write this review because people around here get pretty serious about their sushi and I'm sure those same people have not been to SQwers. It is a small place on Geary. The decor is non existent. It isn't trendy or unique. 

However. 

As a sushi roll lover, I love this place. The cost is reasonable, arguably "low", the selection is abundant and you can get your sushi to go.
author: Ashley W.

description:
I have nothing but good things to say! I've just leased an apartment about a block away so this place is super convenient and obviously inexpensive. 

That being said, I'm writing because I've been here on several occasions just to order take out and the service is always really nice. It's never too packed so I guess that's why but we were given miso soup even though we were getting food to go. Only one of us were ordering food but they still served us both water and miso soup as a courtesy and still seated us. It's just a nice little touch that keeps me coming back. 

This place is perfect for people who live or are staying nearby!
author: Rumneek B.

description: So yummy! I used to order from Sakesan (ick) but this spot is my new go to. The sushi and sashimi are fresh and the rolls look beautiful. The delivery time is so quick as well. We ordered and Eat24 said it would be 60-90 minutes and the food arrived in 1/2 an hour. Will continue loyalty to this place. I recommend the Lion King Roll as well as the Spider Roll.
author: Alix T.

description:
I've ordered to go both times from this restaurant. The rolls are pretty standard as you will find anywhere else. If you're looking to get rolls that are satisfying enough, I would recommend this place. 

Now the two item I ordered. If you're ordering online- FYI, the lunch special and dinner special does come with rice and salad (not stated online). The Donkatsu was dry and a bit overcooked.. spicy tuna roll was also very standard. I was definitely not impressed with the miso soup- it was bland and tasted right out of  package.
author: Sarah K.

description: F ing awesome people work here. Food is excellent. My thought halfway through dinner, I wanna have my birthday here. Its that fun.
author: J G.

description: I had ordered from my usual sushi spot so many times this week I was embarrassed to go back.  So I decided to try a new place and Sqwers did not disappoint.  Sashimi plate was fresh and included all my favorite fish.  Lamb chops were tasty.  Chicken yakitori also tasty.  Tempura was nicely battered and fried.  The hamachi kama was huge, tender and delicious! Delivery was speedy and they offer free rolls depending on how much you spend on your order. Was pleasantly surprised!
author: Chelsey G.

description:
Great Sushi, even better service.

My dog escaped through the door when the delivery driver arrived- he even helped me chase him down and bring him back into the apartment!

Will definitely order from again!
author: Chris W.

description: Really really really bad service and attitude. I went there at 4:58pm, be  told we CAN NOT order until 5:00pm, WTF..  so we wait till 5:03, asked again, get the same answer. That's not the worst part. When I try to find out how long do we need to wait. The answer is I DONT KNOW, so I give up and choice never come back
author: Minsheng L.

description:
Not only is this place inexpensive and tasty, the service is amazing.  Their bento lunch special is $7.99 and gives you two items, rice, salad, and soup.  I had the chicken katsu and teriyaki chicken.  The katsu was amazing, but I think the chicken was overdone.  

I went for dinner a week afterwards with the intention of dropping off some snail mail.  The dinner combo isn't that much more than the lunch special ($12.99).  I chose the chicken katsu and teriyaki salmon.  The server commented on my wise choice because my food ended up being twice the size of my boyfriend's.  You know what that means people, ya gotta order the same as I did! 

After finishing my amazing katsu and perfectly grilled salmon, we went home happily food baby impregnated.  Later on that night, I reached into my purse to send my mail off and realized that I left it at Sqwers.  I felt like such an idiot!  I called and they had my mail.  They offered to mail it off for me.  Who does that?  Amazing people who make delicious food!
author: Lisa X.

description:
The neighborhood definitely needed another eating choice! Service was fast and pleasant, and the prices are really reasonable. We went for dinner over the weekend and didn't have to wait at all. 

We opted for the sushi, which was made well and seemed to have good quality fish.  Wish we had tried the skewers!
author: AJ L.

description: Just your typical sushi bar. nothing that special here. pretty good customer service though, came by quite a few times to refill water cups/made sure everything was good.  I was expecting a few more tables to be filled for a Saturday night but I guess it was just slow the day I went.  What I thought was cool was that the owner was taking sake bombs with the table next to us.  He seemed very friendly, even gave half a bottle of beer away to a table.  Other than that, nothing too special here.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
First time here today and was pleasantly surprised. Overall, the food is pretty tasty and on point with food in Japan. The customer service is outstanding. 

We were in the neighborhood trying to find a Japanese place for lunch near City Target. 

Ordered 
- 2 skewers: Chicken skin and gizzard. 
- lunch bento: tempura and katsu
- oyako don

The bento arrived with chicken teriyaki instead of katsu. Mistake was pointed out to the staff. Although we told him that it was okay and we'll just eat the teriyaki, the chef/owner(?) made us a extra large order of katsu for free.

Get the katsu!! The batter is very light and flaky and the chicken is very moist. It was delicious. The katsu sauce is diluted slightly so that it's not as thick, which I liked. 

Bill was about $20. Great value. American size portions for great tasting Japanese food. Sure beats a lot of the Japanese places in the Sunset and Richmond. 

Would like to come back and try more of the izakaya menu.
author: Kar Y.

description:
Solid, solid 4 stars, with an extra star for being a great new addition to the neighborhood and offering friendly service.

My order was to-go, so I can't comment on wait service.  But if the greeter (owner?) being smiling and offering me a seat while I wait was an inkling of what I might receive when I am to dine eventually, I'll probably really enjoy that, too.

I am truly a Japanese food purist, I have to say.  I don't usually order rolls or teriyaki, things that you wouldn't really see in a traditional Japanese restauarant or at a home table.  I can further say that I limit most often to sashimi and would love, someday, to truly experience Kaiseki.  But on this day wanting to support a new local restaurant, I ordered a little bit of everything:

- Dynamite Roll
- Jalapeno Roll
- Saba Nigiri
- Tuna Nigiri
- Albacore Tataki
- Lotus Chips (I bet these are served hot when you dine in.  Though mine weren't hot, they were still very tasty.  I might have to put in a special order for the 2014 Super Bowl party...along with some wasabi dipping sauce).

All of the items were very well made and the quality above average.  Portion sizes were thoughtful and the rolls were not ridiculously overdone with too many combinations of Western influence that some restaurants serve.  They had quality ingredients that complemented each other.

I also got a free roll because of the total cost of the order.  Usually, the free roll is the Dynamite Roll.  Since I already had one, I asked if I could have a different one.  He said California Roll and, although I'm not a huge fan by any means, the offer itself was nice and I wasn't going to haggle something that was really a gift.

I look forward to being a hoody regular and that they are able to be successful in this location.
author: Tamar D.

description:
I found this place because I was lazy and was craving sushi. Obviously, I am a strange person. These people deliver sushi. Could you ask for anything more?
I ended up braving the winter cold and walking the 5 minutes through the USF campus to Geary to get sushi at 8PM on a Saturday. It was magical. There was a lively party in there that kept taking sake bombs with some of the staff. The staff was really nice and laughed at my boyfriend and I when we ordered the 30pc. sashimi (for 39.99!) because they didn't think we could handle that, a roll, complimentary soup, and a seaweed salad. They obviously don't know us at all.
The sashimi was fresh and amazing and all of the other dishes we saw come out to other tables looked great! I can't wait to come back to try other things.
I am not one to support random sushi places because they have OK food and are cheap. I will go the extra mile and spend the $100 on a dinner for two because I want fresh raw fish.
This definitely has me rethinking my strategy. They aren't cheap enough to scare me away with random baked rolls and weird Americanized names. They are authentic while maintaining a student's pricepoint. 
It is dangerous that they are so close to where I stay in the city. Sashimi for me, all day everyday.
author: Jenna R.

description: This place is adorably cute, no frills. Sushi is good. Absolutely loved the thick sashimi cuts.  People are friendly. A bit expensive compared to what I'm used to, but whatever. I do wish there was a sushi bar, it looks like they have the space for it where the chefs create.  I got the chef's 10 piece sashimi, 2 seaweed salads and a rainbow roll (split for my dinner and lunch the next day-it all held up fine). Also hot sake.
author: K H.

description:
I order delivery from SQwers about once a week and have taken a large family group to the restaurant itself. The experience is always good. The sushi is always fresh and reasonably portioned. Delivery is free.

The guy in charge (owner/manager?) was really friendly, fun and helpful with getting the right dishes ordered for a group where some people weren't very familiar with Japanese food -- including some kids. The customer service has been consistently good and if there's anything wrong they fix it promptly. I once had the wrong order delivered (two delivery orders got mixed up and dropped to the wrong people). I called and they said they'd send out the right order immediately and to keep the first one. So I got to sample a whole other meal for free and discovered some new favorites!

It's not inexpensive but not outrageous for sushi, and the overall experience is worth the money.
author: Michael H.

description: Good sushi, good prices and service. I wish they had their own spicy sauce for their "spicy" sushi rolls. They just put siracha on it. Kinda cheapened the flavor and experience. Otherwise their other rolls were good.
author: Tamara D.

description: I catered a $167 lunch from here on 2/6/15. I ordered the sashimi sampler. I was VIOLENTLY ill with food poisoning that night and it ruined my trip to Napa. I had eaten the same dinner Thurs, breakfast Fri and dinner Fri as my friend did, so I know it came from here at lunch. Words cannot explain how miserable I was.
author: Erin N.

description: Incredibly fast delivery to NoPa. The ramen and udon are decent but the rolls are better.
author: Mariko F.

description:
