The other reviews are hype. This is not a real Japanese restaurant, it's a Cantonese impersonation of Japanese food. There's so many of these in SF that Yelp should consider making them a separate category. 

Great service and nice people, but if you're in the mood for a real izakaya then drive a few more block down Geary and you'll find plenty.
author: Ignignot F.

description:
Like the other reviews, the servers are hilarious and always offering you sake or some other yummy thing to drink. DELICIOUS food for a perfect price. I came on a date w the man friend and we had to greatly narrow down what to order bc it soon turned into half the menu. Try the tuna collar. Just do it. It's fantastic and melt in you mouth. 
Food: fantastic
Servers: hilarious 

I wish the lighting was dimer, but if that's my only complaint then SCORE. 
Soon to be regular!!
author: Kat H.

description:
This place is super close to my house so of course I had to try it out. I was hoping for anything better than that last place, Red Wings -- yuck, and man is it better. 

I haven't tried the sushi yet, but the chicken teriyaki lunch combo was SO worth the 7 bucks. I got the chicken with tempura combo. Usually when you get tempura with the combo you get like 4 veggies and one measly shrimp, I must have had at least 8 veggies in there and a big a** shrimp. 

The staff is super friendly so for that fact alone you really want to see them succeed! I def will be back.

Welcome to the neighborhood!
author: Farryn L.

description:
Stopped in for lunch here a few times and each time seemed like a different experience.  Different servers but same issues.  The menu is your typical Japanese sushi/bento/udon stuff.  A lunch special with two items and a page of custom sushi rolls too.  The specialty of the house is skewers of meats that range from a dollar to six dollars.
The food was about average but the three times I ate there, the order was messed up every time.  It seemed to me to be a language barrier problem but who knows.  It's a smaller place with a big screen TV and small sushi bar.  No alcohol bar.
The food and portion was just OK for the price.  Street parking is OK nearby.
author: Pablo R.

description: The restaurant was cute & clean. I had the lion king roll while a friend had the bento box, both were reasonably priced and very good.The staff were very friendly and attentive. I'd recommend it for lunch or dinner!
author: Lei T.

description:
I was visiting the city a few weeks ago and a girlfriend took me to SQwers. I wasn't sure what to expect but it GREAT! For one, they greet you with a bowl of miso. FREE MISO. 

THESE ARE MY KINDA PEOPLE. 

The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful (probably refilled my water 100 times) and the food was fast and delicious. The owner (I assume) came over and talked to us (he was hilarious) and even gave us a few rounds of Sake. 

I will be back :)

(They also had gluten-free soy sauce. Mega plus!)
author: Dana W.

description:
We went on a Saturday and the waiters were very animated that night for some reason. One waiter went around pouring us rounds of sake on the house. When asked what was the occasion, he said "It's the weekend!' Not sure if this was the norm, but if you get manhandled by a particular waiter encouraging you to drink the "gentle juice" aka mystery sake, just know everything's going to be okay!

What we had:
- 30 sashimi super deluxe platter - fresh, plenty for three
- hamachi kama - the portion was bigger than expected, great for a cooked fish
- chicken karage - batter is a little too thick
- miso soup
author: H B.

description:
Ditto on the friendly staff, felt like eating at my parents' house minus the awkward "when are you getting married" talk.

The lunch specials are great. For $8 you get a choice of 2 items that come with rice, soup, and salad. I got california roll and chicken katsu chased down with some hot green tea. Yum! Will be back.
author: Tatyana K.

description: New place. Cool and comfy environment!  Friendly staff. Fresh fish and many special sushi specials done by the sushi chef!  Surprised by the variety and creativity on the sushi. Price is just right. Please see my photos. Those are the ones i had Friday night! Delicious and will become a regular!
author: Jan H.

description:
Close to being 4 stars but the service pushes it to 5. They seemed a little understaffed when the place was full on a Friday at 7:30, but the waiter was apologetic and brought an on-the-house octopus and cucumber appetizer. Once our order started to come he stopped by again with a couple comped sake shots and again later with a full bottle of hot sake.  After the 7:30 crowd left it stayed half empty but it meant the service got better and even more free sake. 

The food wasn't mind blowing but solid sushi.  We had the chefs choice sashimi and the cherry blossom and some kind of spicy tuna n hamachi(?)  rolls. The maguro sashimi prob wasn't the freshest but the other 4 types were all good. Don't remember what types of fish were in the Cherry Blossom roll, but it was fantastic. The spicy roll was also good, but the jalapeño on the top is pretty spicy. 

Tonight was the first time there but considering the experience, I'm sure we'll be back to give it another try next time we're craving sushi.
author: Niall H.

description: Previously rated this place poorly, however after much consideration I give this place 5 stars. Why you ask? A) Its close proximity to my house. B) For the price the food is dank. C) The host is very generous with sake once you get goin. D) How often do I eat here? Multiple times per week and am never disappointed.
author: Patrick M.

description:
Went here on my birthday...

Rolls were great, very fresh tasting and delicious. Friends treated me to several rounds of Saki Bombs and dinner. Lee, our waiter, was outstanding and gave us a free order of saki and gave me a free bottle of saki to take home. Will be back.
author: Michael K.

description: I have been here 3 times and haven't had a bad experience yet! The food, drink, service is all great. Im already planning my next visit. Although I think I may have to UBER there next time and we always seem to drink too many sake bombs!
author: Melody M.

description:
I almost hate writing a review for this place considering its such an unknown gem.

Never-the-less, what an awesome experience. My wife and I came here with the intent of just getting our "sushi fix". It's a secluded place in a very secluded part of the city (in terms of other restaurants around). We got the 30 piece chef's choice and the ultimate tuna roll, it was a LOT of fish. Lee (saki-moto) is one of the owners, and since the place is still pretty new he and Sqwers' co-owner Simon served us. 

The food, amazing, they obviously really care about freshness of their fish. They decorate the plate up a bit too, the sashimi is served on these nice little bamboo boxes. (rolls are served on plates) They are still new and are thus still building the menu, they have uni, hamach i(blue fin), salmon, yellow fin... all the usual, but they have something I've never seen before called Tai, it's a fish Lee gets from Vietnam, its pretty similar to red snapper in taste and texture.

We had am amazing time here, they don't have a corkage fee, Saki-moto encouraged us to bring our own saki.
author: Shawn S.

description: Got my order thru Grubhub. Food was undercooked, cold, and seems like it was prepared yesterday or last week... Avoid this place.
author: Bob L.

description: Combo meal is both generous and delicious. I eat lots of Japanese food and this is going to be my go to option from now on.
author: John-Mark I.

description: I love this place! Great sushi and friendly staff. They kept bringing us sake shots on the house which was cool. We had the winter wonderland, Godzilla and hot and spicy snapper rolls which were all really good.
author: Cheriana G.

description: In the past two years I've had great experiences at sqwers so im sad to have to give a bad review. However, as of recent they have not answered their phone on two occasions when I was trying to place an order. Most recently, I placed an online order, hoping to get service and I received a call 15 minutes later from the online delivery system stating they would have to refund me due to lack of response from the restaurant. Not sure if they're too busy to answer the phone or what but it's been frustrating. Good food but i'll have to find another sushi place that wants my business.
author: Leah S.

description: I was looking for sushi delivery and came across this place. I was expecting a lot because it's rated 4 stars but I was really unimpressed. The spicy tuna was flavorless and looked gray. The dragon roll was uneventful. Delivery was quick which is nice but does not make up for the food
author: Petra M.

description: By far my favorite sushi spot in the city. I love the selection quality and above all hospitality. We ordered the golden gate roll, cherry blossom roll and red hot chili pepper roll and all three were exceptionally good. Lee, our favorite server there gave us a taste of his spicy sake creation which was by far the highlight of our meal. Be prepared to drink, hidden gem of Geary. Very sweet people, excellent meal, recommend it to my friends 100 %!
author: Carina K.

description: worst ever. Waiting for the food over 1.5H is not only unbelievable but also ridiculous.  How could this kind of restaurant still open???
author: Mio S.

description:
ordered delivery from here until the quality gradually worsened over the last year. pretty much 2 stars based on food at this point. try yuubi instead for higher quality sushi delivered in this area.

what prompted me to give sqwers a 1 star review is that i came in here for lunch, waited around for the lady who told me to wait longer before being told to wait by the sushi chef 10 minutes later to wait...all in all, 15 minutes of standing in front of a tiny restaurant like an idiot waiting to be seated.

i left to grab lunch somewhere else instead and would recommend you do the same.
author: Sherman L.

description: The service was amazing and the sushi was pretty delicious.  Price wise it was surprisingly not bad especially once we got out food amand saw the portion sizes. The quality is def. A bang for your buck.
author: Dmitriy V.

description: YUM! We had miso soup within seconds of walking in the door, the melon saki shots were delish!, the red and white roll was so yummy, and the staff was very friendly. I'd definitely recommend this place. It's on the smaller side with lackluster decor but it is worth the trip.
author: Lindsay L.

description: This was my first place I ate at when I moved here & now it's the first place I take anyone visiting me in SF. Everything I've tried over the years is INCREDIBLE but more than anything what always brings me back is the people! Many laughs, sake bombs & memories over the years. You must go!
author: B S.

description: I came here on a Wednesday afternoon. I was tired, hungry, and wet from the rain with a mad, irrevocable hankering for albacore sashimi. The servers were sweet and funny and understanding to my plight. The sashimi was satisfying and completely sufficient without the usual overkill. Everything was reasonably priced...I might even say it was hella cheap.
author: Terry T.

description:
Previously I had a higher star review. I recently came back and I am totally upset with this place now.

I ordered from Eat 24 for pick up. I ordered two salmon sashimis, 1 california roll, 1 winter wonderland. Simple. Easy. There's only one major roll in this order. I watched as the order was received within seconds of being sent. The order was estimated 20 minutes to be done, standard.

I came in at 20 minutes on the dot and was told that the food isn't ready. Okay, so I awkwardly stood there. I was thinking "it's just 1 major roll, shouldn't take long. I wasn't expecting a plus service or anything, like being given a cup of tea or water. But a little goes a long way.

There was two sushi chefs, 1 male worker (the boss im assuming) and a woman. The woman kept walking, bussing tables, then sitting back down at a big table. I'm assuming they had customers that were family friends that day. She barely even looked at me.

So after standing there for 15 MINUTES (meaning its been 35 MINUTES since I placed the order), I just told the bus lady I'm leaving. This was beyond ridiculous. How is it that sushi was continuously being pumped from two sushi chefs to tables and not me, standing there, who ordered 30 minutes ago. It does NOT TAKE 15 MINUTES to make ONE SUSHI ROLL.

I had to go through Eat24 Customer service to get a refund. To think that I even wanted to tip 10% for a pick up order (which isn't mandatory). I wasn't even acknowledged ONCE after I was told my order wasn't ready. It's very upsetting that a place like this, that I felt was really great, irked me so bad like this. I'm never coming back. I could've ordered sushi from Geary and 25th and had them deliver my food faster than them.
author: Iris L.

description: a very good restuarant！highly recommend！The los locos nuggets is my faverite dish！nice service，delicious Japanese food!
author: Stone L.

description: This Japanese restaurant is nutritious and delicious. If you want to try amazing Japanese food, here is the place!
author: Qingchen M.

description: I hate writing this review but maybe the owners can use this as constructive criticism. This place used to be ok for what everyone else says, affordable mediocre sushi at best. HOWEVER, the last trip to Skqewers almost resulted in a trip to the ER. My husband had a violent food poisoning episode after we ate here and we didn't even have raw sushi. We should've guessed sanitation isn't on their priority list. When the server came to clear the plates, he asked if we wanted the last piece on the plate. We said no, and he said ok, I'll have it and proceeded to pick it up with his bare hand and pop it in his mouth. Are you effing kidding me?! Gross. Never again. Never again.
author: Crystal N.

description: I have been sitting at this restaurant for about 60 minutes and have yet to be served. Basically, I'm asking myself WHERE IS MY FOOD?! This review is purely on the crap service and not the food I have yet to receive.
author: Mary Christine I.

description: I've have sushi delivered from this place several times via eat24, and each time it has been worse.  Tonight was the nadir.  Everything tasted of chlorine, but the flying fish roe was utterly spoiled--so bad I had to spit it out.  This place should be condemned, the proprietors should be prosecuted for poisoning the innocent.
author: Francesco D.

description: extremely disappointed in my delivery this evening......ordered hamachi toro and paid the supplement  was so excited because of the beautiful buttery delicious hamachi toro sashimi i saw from here in pics on yelp......to my disappointment this is not the quality that i received  they gave me the worst cut of the fish, regular hamachi at best, definately not toro, yes im white but i know the fucking difference assholes, it was the part at the end of the fish where its mostly red and has that fishy\sterling silver taste to it  sushi foodies will know what im talking about  thanks for putting a damper on my evening fuckers
author: Lizz M.

description:
DO NOT ORDER ONLINE! The drivers don't know what they're doing, the restaurant does not care, and the food isn't worth it. BEWARE!!!

After placing our order on Eat24hours.com we were given a 45-60 minute time frame for delivery (very standard on their site). After an hour had passed, I called the restaurant to ensure the driver was out on delivery. I was assured that he was but it was slow due to the rain, which is understandable. After another 20 minutes, the driver called me saying he was here. I buzzed the door and waited. 5 minutes passed with no one coming up so my boyfriend went down but no one was there. I called the driver back, who didn't answer, then called the restaurant and they said he would come right back. But 15 minutes passed, he still hadn't arrived. I had to contact Eat24hours.com support to help which still took 45 minutes. I have no idea where the driver was during the hour long experience but overall waiting 2 hours for a subpar, ice cold meal is unacceptable. The restaurant offered a 30% discount as an apology which was at least something I guess...

5 stars for Eat24hours.com, 0 stars for the restaurant. Waiting 2 hours for a half empty bento box is ridiculous.
author: Peyton S.

description: Best cheap sushi around. Simon is the best! They are always very nice and the miso soup always comes hot! The sushi always tastes fresh. My go-to sushi place, and they take rezzies!
author: Nicole L.

description: Put in an order over the phone for the lunch bento box for $8.99 (4 piece spicy tuna sushi, 20 piece teriyaki steak, salad, rice, soup). Bento box is better than I expected for the price and the staff was very nice and prompt. Good place to grab a quick lunch if you are in the area.
author: Jamie G.

description: This place is great! Not only for their good food but they're excellent service. I'm mainly talking about Simon. I can't remember how many times I've come in and he's always had a smilie face and a kind word. Sometimes I even get a free shot of Nigeria or spicy sake. Así mon really cheers the place up :)
author: Me Like Good Food S.

description:
I came here on a whim with my friend cause I was starving and this place had good reviews on yelp. We came on a Friday night, no wait time but the place was full. I wasn't in the mood for rolls or the small plates or anything, so i got the dinner combo. Maaaaaan it was good. For 12 bucks you really get your money's worth! I got the chicken katsu + agedashi tofu combo,  and it was a looooot of food ^_^ super yummy and i was really full, which really surprised me. 
Other than that, the service was AMAZING haha! The lady that served us was super attentive, always refilled my water and asked if the food was good. She was super sweet.  This guy was also going around checking up on the customers, making jokes and offering drinks. He was even massaging this guy's shoulders who had a couple of drinks, haha. He was very hospitable, super welcoming and pretty hilarious. He reminded me of one of my favorite waiters from Kowloon Tong from awhile back.  I loved the service here! This might be a new spot to come by often :) The only thing that I wished was that the place was a little bigger but I can't really complain.
author: Kathleen A.

description:
Good Sushi at a good price.

Friend suggested we try this place and I'm glad he did. When we showed up the wait staff were very friendly and festive. Waiter took shots of sake with us and provided a complimentary bowl of edamame.

Sushi was surprisingly good, especially for the $10-12 price range. Winter Wonderland was my favorite roll and they had a good combination of other rolls.
author: Michael M.

description: My roommates and I adore this place!! The rolls are amazing and the price is right. Every time we go, the service is really friendly and they treat us well. We typically order three rolls and split them. The portions are pretty big. It's kind of a hole in the wall, but it's super cozy and we've never had to wait. I can't wait to try their delivery service. Would totally recommend this place to anyone looking for good sushi at a great price near USF.
author: Alana R.

description: Fresh fish.. Great service.. Loved the ginger ice cream, spicy sake a must!!!. Mango tango great desert roll finish. Skewers great appetizer.... Best server simon and chef lee
author: Hsiao-Wei C.

description: I just got my delivery of 3 rolls, 1 sushi combo and 2 miso soups. The bag looked as if it was thrown around, the sushi was messy, and one of our miso soups had opened and soaked our tempura roll, the bottom of the bag was all soup. It totally ruined our dinner. Wont be ordering again.
author: M B.

description: I got this delivered and it was very delicious and economical! I got 4 rolls, Udon and a seaweed salad for $35 due to a special going on. The sushi was tasty and the delivery was fast. My only complaint is they have very limited hours.
author: Sam D.

description: Their staff is amazing! I seriously cannot recall better service at a food establishment than what I experienced here. First off, they never let a water cup go empty! My friend's and my cup probably got filled five times over the course of our meal; even if I took only a few sips, they still refilled it! Secondly, one of the waiters (the man with the glasses) was so friendly and quirky; I loved him! I got a high five, pat on the back, and got offered some drinks. I even saw him massaging another customer's shoulders (which can be creepy for some, I know. But if you see this guy in person, you can't hate him!) The waitress was a sweetheart too. I noticed she notices little details like how to serve the dishes in front of me; she purposely turned the plate so the main meat dish was closest to me while the side with the salad was farthest. Overall, excellent service!
author: Kirsten H.

description: SQwers Izakaya is easy to overlook when you're walking down the street.  Don't. The manager is extremely friendly and welcoming, and on both times I've visited he's had my group seated immediately and steaming miso soup in front of us very quickly.  The food is good, with a nice selection of skewers, rolls, noodles and bento offerings available. They've also got some nice smooth sake, and the manager is generous about refills. Try the spicy sake if you like spicy - but beware if you've got sensitive tastebuds!
author: A N.

description:
I cannot recommend this place enough and here's why:

Greet us at the door with sake bombs? CHECK

Teach us how to count in Japanese and take sake bombs with staff? CHECK

Amazing food at a good price? CHECK

Complimentary rolls, skewers, and sake because they're awesome? DOUBLE 
CHECK

Epic fun time? TRIPLE CHECK

Go here - I promise you'll have some great food, a good time, and not break the bank.
author: Daniel A.

description: This place is delicious, easy and fun...love the freshness of the fish and the cool disposition of the staff ~ enjoying yourself when working and engaging with patrons in a joyful & accommodating way is always a good path...fun decor too! On a side note I was recommended to this place by my airbnb host & regardless of the few reviews not so favorable I encourage you to dig in & enjoy !!
author: Caligirl P.

description: Great service, delicious food and fun atmosphere! Usually come here with a larger group of people (8-15) and it's always a great experience.
author: Olya L.

description: My go-to sushi spot by my house.  Friendly staff and great sushi!
author: Rachel D.

description: This Japanese restaurant got the most  incredible food, the presentations were awesome, good location and easy to find parking.  Staff were very friendly, prices were reasonable, I am a vegetarian and so thankful that they have many vegetarian dishes to choose from,   I will definitely take my friends and family to this restaurant again, "I shall return!"
author: Urine U.

description: You come for the sushi, but you stay and keep coming back for THE Simon. He is an incredible host and always makes you glad you came, leaving with a smile and a belly full of sake. He is awesome. The sushi is great too.
author: Kylie T.

description: This place is awesome. The sqweres are to die for (sausage and chicken skin are my favorite). The sushi is fresh and tasty (favorites include godzilla and lazy summer). The service is on point, Simon and Lee will take care of you. Can't go wrong here :)
author: Ollie G.

description: Great restaurant, will come back! The restaurant is clean and spacious, sushi rolls are priced average, presented well (not too big/little or rolled messily, generous fish portions), and tasted great.  I highly recommend the wasabi hama roll if you like hamachi. The service is excellent - nice waiter who never let our glasses get empty. Thanks to yelpers who wrote about this new place, otherwise I wouldn't have tried it!
author: CM P.

description: I went in there tonight with my girlfriend and they immediately greeted us with a hot bowl of soup and a spicy shot of saki(super spicy). The sushi chef came out multiple times and explained the each roll to us. The fish was very fresh! Also the Toro was amazing. Great time.
author: Farlen M.

description:
Great sushis, mostly fresh, amazing salmon sashimi and rolls. (Dragon roll especially)
Free rolls so appreciated too when ordering for delivery!
Best sushis in Sf
author: Florence O.

description: This place is literally around the corner from my house, so they immediately have brownie points for convenience. We stopped in at about 9 and were quickly seated. The waitress brought us tea and miso soup (on the house!) right away. We ordered a chicken yakatori, 49er roll, British Columbia roll, and a spider roll. Everything we had was delicious. The only downside was that the chicken yakatori was only two small skewers for $5 and it took a little long to get the bill. Other than that, I adore this place!
author: Angel J.

description: Decided to come here since the Ramen Festival in Jtown was a total disaster.  We made the right call!  Seated right away, food didn't take long at all, and the service was just outstanding.  I would only come here when "Crazy Simon" is working, because of his excellent service!  He offered great recommendations and even gave us an additional free appetizer!  But even without that, this place has great food and service.  Definitely worth coming back to!
author: Ronel M.

description: Good sushi, great service. Talk to any of the wait staff and they will take care of you, and probably take sake bombs with you. If you like spicy ask for some lee sauce (made by one of the waiters). Also it's usually never  busy, which makes it a great personal experience.
author: Brett R.

description: We placed a large order and it came much sooner than they said it would and it was around lunch hour.  It just did not seem fresh and too fishy.  When Trader Joe's is better and a deli down the street is better there is a problem and we have also eaten at several restuarants so we are not new to sushi.  I read the reviews and was anxious to try a place that we could order from frequently.  We did this on GrubHub, who gave us a credit, but the restuarant did not apologize or offer up anything - we will just not order or recommend them.  It was not so  much about getting anything back as even a concern on why we were not happy.
author: Debra J.

description: One of the best owners you can ever enjoy your dinner with. I knew Lee from Ninki Sushi on Taravel. He now established his own restaraunt on Geary. He has a kind heart and always down to drink with you (sake bombs). He Truly takes care of all his customers and can make you feel at home. The full menu will be coming shortly, as well as the grand opening. Be sure to visit.
author: Lawrence N.

description: The teriyaki chicken had no flavor. Chicken seemed boiled not grilled and the sauce was super runny...would have been okay but no flavor. 1.5 hours to deliver...Take out FAIL.
author: Patrick F.

description: First review on Yelp! I had a late dinner tonight, I ordered 25 minutes before they closed. I ordered a lion king and crazy roll along with a miso soup. Great experience, good taste!
author: Michael B.

description: I love this place!  What draws me here over other Sf sushi bars is the food and the service.  Let's talk about the food: their sqwers,  which they are known for,  are flavored &  in generous portions.  Their chicken gizzards &  hearts are seasoned well,  &  you find yourself ordering more than one order.  Their sushi rolls are delicious -  lion King &  winter Wonderland are our favorite &  the sauces are never over welcoming to the fresh fish.  Their ratio to rice & fish is great (not like other sushi places that give you more rice than fish). The atmosphere is the most welcoming -  lots of regulars come by &  the staff treat them as if they're family. It's a small restaurant so if you're thinking of bringing more than 4 people I'd definitely call for a heads up. Did I mention they have delivery  too? &  it doesn't take them 45 mins to respond to an order -  I see them pay close attention whenever they get online Orders.
author: Terri G.

description: Awesome food but come for the staff. Not sure of names but the owner and the dude with the pony tail are solid. Super cool guys and down to pound saki. Go now.
author: Mark H.

description: This place is great--really good quality, and super fun-loving guys that work here--it's a party when you go in.  Far superior to similarly priced Japanese places on the Geary corridor.  Never too crowded, and parkable out front.
author: Kurt S.

description: I highly recommend this place if you enjoy being called a p**sy a** b**ch by the delivery guy. If that is not your cup of tea, I would avoid. I'm seriously at a loss for words.
author: Michael C.

description:
Note to other take out restaurants, this is customer service!

Ordered take out on New Years Eve and was told that it would be a 20 minute wait. We came right on time and was told that it might be a while and considering the hangover I was nursing, this really pissed me off. I was told to take a seat by the owner and his wife at which point I was offered sake and given miso soup. They apologized profusely as I waited about 15 more minutes. I was given my order and realized that they had thrown in an 8 piece California Roll just for my troubles. The owner even shook my hand as I walked out. 

The food itself was very good, especially the Nigiri Deluxe. They put a small amount of roasted garlic purée on top of some of the sushi and it really complemented the fish!
author: Chris F.

description: Went hungry 30 minutes before closing a Wednesday night. Totally empty, but they had phone orders waiting to be picked up. So, super quick service & I was eating my delicious & fresh sake sashimi & hawaiian roll in no time.  The miso soup was very yummy & flavorful with many chives, tofu cubes & seaweed not at all bland warm water. My only complaint, the avocado in my roll was slightly brown, likely an avocado halve that had been cut earlier from another order's roll, but whatever. Overall this place is pretty good. Tasted fresh. I'll need to return to try more things.
author: Mariajose A.

description: Great local spot for delivery, takeout, or casual dining! Staff is super friendly and gets to know the locals. Enjoy the sake bombs!
author: Brent T.

description: This place is adorable and the staff are the nicest! We had wings, taro chips, 49er roll. The food wasn't bad, and they gave us all of these little dishes that were on the house and we got to have sake shots with the staff. Pretty awesome, I'd say!
author: Denise H.

description:
Pricing: Good. My friends treated me, but judging from the menu, the pricing is normal.
Quality: Good-Excellent. Some of the biggest calamari I ever had!
Turnaround: Good. Felt quick, but that may just be the appetizers talking.
Service: Excellent. Only the bento orders get miso soup, but the lady gave all of us miso soup on the house.

Japanese food is not cheap where a simple roll with barely any sashimi can average about $10. From the menu, the items were pretty normal and there were bento specials where you can get more than a full meal.  I had the unagi fried rice with soft shell crab and calamari for appetizers. First off, biggest calamari I ever had! Not much taste, but the texture was good and bouncy. The soft shell crab was also pretty big and meaty. None of that spiny crab stuff. The crab was also full of eggs, which is not my cup of tea, but I heard this makes the crab better. They also sell skewered chicken gizzards here. Definitely not my cup of tea, but just FYI. The unagi fried rice was good, but I think I will stick with the broiled eel donburi. Also, my friend ordered some teriyaki chicken and although I can see the meat, I could not discern any taste whatsoever. The teriyaki sauce was barely sweet and the meat was really just texture sliding across my tongue. The teriyaki salmon was much better. The tables are really small here so with the appetizers we ordered and the free miso soup for everyone, we quickly ran out of space. This was especially troublesome because the turnaround was pretty good and the food arrived almost at the same time. Most importantly though is that the lady who looks like she runs the shop kept coming over to help us clear the table. And like I said before, she gave all of us free miso soup on the house. That with the free edamame in the beginning makes this a good place to come again.
author: Jenny W.

description: First timer and couldn't be more pleased.  We have been looking for over a year now for a good Japanese delivery place and by God I think we've found it.  Vegetable Udon was delish and kids ate it up with abandon.  Salmon sashimi was great.  Gyoza were crispy and good - both the pork and the veggie.  The chicken teriyaki was (according to my husband) good - with only bits of fat - but he's very picky.  The delivery was fast the order taker was delightful.  We will definitely order from here next time!!!
author: Tara U.

description: I went back and forth on a three or four star rating then decided on a three. The food is good and prices aren't too bad but it's not that much better or cheaper than most neighborhood Japanese places.  The one thing that I did like is that the sushi rolls did not have a large amount of rice.   It was a good balance of tics and filling so that I could actually taste the filling and not just rice.   The tempura as crispy and not too oily. It was actually still hot, not just warm, when it arrived, which is rare.   I did not care for the ramen though.  I poke the slightly curly firm noodles.  This was a straight, white, chewy noodle. The broth wasn't rich, like  they should be for ramen. It was almost like a chicken soup base that you may get  with wonton noodles.
author: Heather G.

description: The staff is always very friendly to my family and the portions of food are very good for the price.  I will go back again.  If you want take out, make sure you order ahead just in case they have a rush of deliveries.
author: Burke M.

description: The lazy summer roll was to die for. The name describes it perfectly. This restaurant is a great, casual lunch place with fabulous service. Go here if you're craving quality, fresh sushi at a reasonable price.
author: Lauren H.

description:
What an amazing restaurant!  Definitely the best sushi in the area and great customer service.

My girlfriend and I had a ton of fun with the staff, and we regret not going here sooner considering we live so close by.  

The food is GREAT.  Everything from the Miso soup to the spicy tuna rolls  were much better than I anticipated.  The prices are not bad at all, considering the quality food you get.

This will definitely become a regular place for me.
author: Michael G.

description:
Solid 5 stars.  

The sushi was very fresh and delicious.  The rolls were very original like the jalapeno roll.  The  fried rice was possibly the best I've ever had.  

The atmosphere is very cozy and comfortable.  There is a flat screen television for your viewing pleasure.  

The service was excellent.  The staff is very friendly and informative and what to order.

I definitely recommend to sushi aficionados and am planning a return  very soon!
author: Dave R.

description: Service is always very attentive when I've been there, although I've never been when it was very busy.  Good sushi for the price, relatively fast too.
author: Robert R.

description: Best place ever... If you ever just want to experience an adventure. The type of place that opens a magic door to childhood then leads you to a place that exists beyond rainbows and in dreams then this is it. Are you ready to dream? Are you?
author: Lawrence F.

description: I love Sqwers! The service is the best, and the food is great, too. I always get the dinner combo. Portions are good-sized, so I always leave full. Best part is that we've never had to wait for a table and the waiters remember us every time.
author: Marissa S.

description: Love this place!! The service is amazing and pretty quick. The miso soup is so amazing!!!! Always soothing on a cold day. Also, their sushi is great! Not a lot of rice which is a definite plus! This is definitely my new sushi place.
author: Brooke T.

description: Went to the new neighborhood Japanese restaurant tonight.  Staff was very friendly and food was very good.  We had a dinner combo with salmon teriyaki & tempura and tonkatsu.  Everything was very freshly prepared with generous portions.  We'll definitely return.
author: Jamie K.

description: I love this place!! I seriously order from them all the time usually weekly when school gets crazy and I need my sushi pronto. Prices are good sushi is great and super friendly personable service that makes you feel welcomed in their restaurant that I rarely find at other sushi places.
author: Lindsey L.

description: Good food at reasonable prices. The staff is super friendly, would definitely go back anytime (already been there 3 times since it opened!).
author: Rahim D.

description: This place is close to where I live so my roommates and I come here if we're feeling too lazy to cook and too lazy to go to a restaurant further away. It's a fairly new spot and run by a Chinese family, I think. It's nice that it's not very busy so you won't need to wait in line. They gave us free bowls of miso soup (not sure if that's a common thing or because we were a big group). They have a fairly extensive menu of sushi's, skewers, and soup noodles at a fair price. I usually go for the godzilla roll. Their gyoza are probably the frozen kind, so don't order them. Their sushi is pretty decent, a good balance of fish and rice and good presentation. If you order tempura, they give a pretty big basket of them. The dinner set is not worth it in my opinion, they give you a sad pile of salad and rice, and the teriyaki chicken tastes bland. I also got frustrated when they took forever to bring my friend's dinner set (which is frankly the easiest dish to make). However, the service is generally quite fast, and I think the servers are nice, attentive people.
author: Leslie C.

description: THIS PLACE IS GREAT! Not only is the food here of great quality, it is also affordable, and the service is excellent! The waiters are always very friendly! (Shout out to Lee and Simon)! Thank you guys! :)
author: Nick D.

description:
the worst and horrible salmon teriyaki and shrimp tempura i've ever had in my 40 years of life on this earth! awfully bad!!!

try for yourself or better stay away from this place at all cost!
author: Ryu K.

description: My friend and I were running on little to no sleep from working so much and needed a great meal. Our destination was The Corner Store, but their kitchen had closed by the time we arrived. We decided to try SQwers (since their liquor license was approved) in desperate need of sustenance. Little did we know we would enjoy an affordable lunch special of salmon and beef teriyaki, sushi, salad, miso soup AND lotus chips! The owner gave us great service and the clean and minimal decor leaves the experience to be the star of the show. I recommend this to any local residents and USF students in need of a great meal at an affordable price.
author: Dali A.

description: We were pleasantly surprised by Sqwers. Although we were about to leave due to the restaurant's cheap-looking exterior, we gave it a try and we're glad we did. Inside we were greeted by our fantastic waiting, who refers to himself as "crazy Simon." He waited on us speedily and efficiently, and although we only waited a short while for our sushi, before we knew it he brought out a free appetizer and apologized for the wait. The sushi itself was delicious - we ended up ordering even more. As we enjoyed our time, Simon came over with Sake as well. He made us laugh and brightened up the whole experience even more. We absolutely would come here again and again.
author: Cosmin B.

description:
I tried this place after reading the previous reviews by others but this place did not live up to expectations food wise... unfortunately, and I was so hoping for a new neighborhood eats!  I guess Midori 2 blocks down is safe from competition for now.  I ordered the special of the day... Tiger roll.  it was basically california roll with cooked shrimp on top... the shrimp were like little films of plastic stuck on top and ordinary imitation crab in the middle, if it wasn't for the avocado it would be hard to swallow.  WHY would you put that on the specials menu!  As a decent sushi chef you would try to tell the customer to order something else instead...salmon skin roll was really salty and fishy so obviously not the freshest.  The chef's sashimi 10 piece was just ok and borderline fresh.  The slicing of the fish weren't professional-- skin were not cleanly removed from the salmon, and the chunks were inconsistent.  Food would be 2 stars but 1 more star for the nice waiter and service.   

Restaurant is tough business in SF but please don't let go so early in the game.  I hope i just came in during an off day so I will give this another try later.  Please keep up the quality!  I really hope this place stays!
author: Adele W.

description: if it wasnt for yelp , i this place would not get a star from me. i have only ate here once and i had the worst expreince. i ordered a bento box with beef. well my beef was undercook a so called "medium" . point is that the meat was cool like they just threw it on the grill of atleast a min . i told the owner and he said it was my fault for walking outside with my food. i have never came back and never will!!!!
author: Glendy C.
